reporting-org.narrative: The federal government of the United States

description.narrative: Support the science and practice of food, feed, and fiber production (including forestry, wildlife, fisheries, aquaculture and floriculture) and its relationships to natural resources, processing, marketing, distribution, utilization (including nutrition), and trade.

This award strives to support the science and practice of food, feed, and fiber production (including forestry, wildlife, fisheries, aquaculture and floriculture) and its relationships to natural resources, processing, marketing, distribution, utilization (including nutrition), and trade. In addition, this award Sector: Agribusiness. Location: Lusaka, Zambia. Summary: the project aims to produce Hungarian sausage using meat that is preservative free. The project also aims to train traditional farmers and cattle farmers in Kalomo, Southern Province, on financial information and training..

participating-org.narrative: The federal government of the United States

owner-org.narrative: The federal government of the United States

mailing-address.narrative: 1400 I Street NW Suite 1000, Washington, DC 20005-2248

description.narrative: Despite its status as a lower-middle income country with mineral wealth, Zambia ranks poorly on human development indicators with child malnutrition and its rural poverty levels among the highest in the world. U.S. assistance to Zambia seeks to reduce poverty through the promotion of agriculture-led economic development and food security; combat deforestation and wildlife poaching; expand and improves the quality of health and education opportunities; fight HIV/AIDS, tuberculosis, and malaria; work to decrease maternal and child mortality; strengthen democratic and accountable governance; and build Zambian capacity to promote regional peace, security, and stability.
